DOCNAME: CASE OF MEHMET NURİ ÇAÇAN v. TURKEY
CONCLUSION: Violation of Article 6 - Right to a fair trial (Article 6 - Criminal proceedings;Article 6-1 - Reasonable time);Violation of Article 13 - Right to an effective remedy (Article 13 - Effective remedy)
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicant was born in DATE and lives in PERSON .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant was arrested and imprisoned after a criminal conviction .
CARDINAL . During the imprisonment it was found that the applicant was mistakenly incarcerated due to his personal identity card being used by his brother in commission of a crime .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG found in favour of the applicant and ordered his release .
CARDINAL . The applicant could only be released on DATE because of extended paperwork .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG ordered the acquittal of the applicant .
CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant lodged criminal complaint with the ORG requesting compensation for his unlawful detention for DATE , pursuant to Law no . CARDINAL .

CARDINAL . During the course of the proceedings , the court held CARDINAL hearings . The applicant was present only at CARDINAL of them , which was held on DATE . The applicant ’s lawyer did not attend to any of the hearings despite having been notified .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court partially granted the applicant ’s request .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of the first - instance court on the ground that the proceedings before ORG had not been finalised at the time when the applicant brought the compensation action before the assize court . It held that the applicant had failed to comply with a prerequisite in order to bring such an action .
CARDINAL . On DATE the court dismissed the case in line with the decision of ORG .
CARDINAL . According to the information in the case file the proceedings are currently pending before ORG .
